Kozara is a 1962 Yugoslav film directed by Veljko BulajiÃ„â€¡. It is a well known film of the partisan film subgenre which was popular in Yugoslavia in the 1960s and 1970s and it depicts events surrounding the Battle of Kozara.

It won the Big Golden Arena for Best Film at the 1962 Pula Film Festival, the Yugoslav national film awards.[1] The film was entered into the 3rd Moscow International Film Festival where it won a Golden Prize.[2] It was also selected as the Yugoslav entry for the Best Foreign Language Film at the 32nd Academy Awards, but was not accepted as a nominee
